en: It isn't easy to figure out the cost.
zh: 算出这笔开销挺不容易的。

en: Have you figured out the cost?
zh: 你算出成本了吗？

en: Relief supplies were raced to the disaster area.
zh: 救援物资被火速送往了灾区。

en: We must provide food and clothes for the victims.
zh: 我们必须给灾民提供食物和衣服。

en: The accused was acquitted on two of the charges.
zh: 被告有两项罪名被判无罪。

en: The accused tried to justify his actions.
zh: 被告试图为自己的行为辩解。

en: The accused was sentenced to death.
zh: 被告被判处死刑。

en: The accused proved to be guilty.
zh: 事实证明被告确实有罪。

en: The accused maintained his innocence.
zh: 被告坚持说自己是清白的。

en: The accused was absolved from the crime.
zh: 被告被宣告无罪。

en: The accused was found not guilty.
zh: 被告被判定无罪。

en: The defendant appealed against the sentence without hesitation.
zh: 被告毫不犹豫地对判决提出了上诉。

en: The accused was condemned to ten years in prison.
zh: 被告被判处了十年有期徒刑。

en: The defendant was sentenced to death.
zh: 被告被判处了死刑。

en: The defendant will appeal to a higher court.
zh: 被告会上诉到更高级别的法院。

en: The prisoner was brought before a judge.
zh: 犯人被带到了法官面前。

en: The accused is to appear before the court on Friday.
zh: 被告周五得出庭。

en: The accused spoke equivocally and didn't want to talk turkey.
zh: 被告说话闪烁其词，不肯开诚布公。

en: Do you think the accused is really guilty of the crime?
zh: 你觉得被告真的犯罪了吗？

en: The subjects for the experiment were chosen at random.
zh: 实验对象是随机选取的。

en: The people for the experiment were chosen at random.
zh: 参加实验的人是随机选的。

en: The gross amount of the loss was larger than 100 million yen.
zh: 损失总额超过了一亿日元。

en: Who gains by the victim's death?
zh: 受害者死了对谁有好处？

en: The victims are entitled to compensation for their injuries.
zh: 受害者有权因受伤得到赔偿。

en: The damage will cost us a lot of money.
zh: 这次损坏得让我们花不少钱。

en: The damage was held to a minimum.
zh: 损失被控制在了最低限度。

en: Rich soil yields good crops.
zh: 土地肥沃，庄稼就长得好。

en: I suffer from obesity.
zh: 我在为肥胖发愁。

en: Fat people generally sweat a lot.
zh: 胖子通常爱出汗。

en: Fat hens lay few eggs.
zh: 胖母鸡产蛋少。

en: The public servant leaked the secret and he was prosecuted for revealing a state secret.
zh: 那个公务员泄露了机密，因泄露国家机密被起诉了。

en: A man who has knowledge of a secret weapon has placed himself behind the eight ball.
zh: 掌握秘密武器信息的人往往会陷入困局。

en: Don't let the cat out of the bag.
zh: 别说漏嘴了。

en: Keep the secret.
zh: 保守秘密。

en: My mind is at ease believing you'll keep the secret.
zh: 相信你会保密，我也就放心了。

en: Make a clean breast of your secrets.
zh: 把你藏着的秘密全招了吧。

en: She may spill the beans.
zh: 她可能会说漏嘴。

en: It is the psychological moment to let the cat out of the bag.
zh: 现在正是揭开秘密的最佳时机。

en: Who is guilty of telling the secret?
zh: 是谁把秘密泄露出去的？

en: Your secret is safe with me.
zh: 我会为你保密的。

en: The secret will emerge in due course of time.
zh: 秘密迟早会水落石出的。

en: The cat is well out of the bag.
zh: 秘密已经彻底公开了。

en: We had a secret meeting.
zh: 我们开了一个秘密会议。

en: Can you keep it a secret?
zh: 你能保密吗？

en: The secret seems to have leaked out.
zh: 秘密好像泄露了。

en: The secret leaked out.
zh: 秘密传出去了。

en: The secret got out.
zh: 消息走漏了。

en: The secretary inserted the letter in the envelope.
zh: 秘书把信装进了信封。

en: The secretary noted down what her boss had said.
zh: 秘书记下了老板说的话。

en: The secretary answered me shortly.
zh: 秘书简短地回答了我。

en: The secretary was dismissed.
zh: 那个秘书被解雇了。

en: The secretary was asked to file past records.
zh: 秘书被要求将以前的记录归档。

en: The secretary took dictation from her boss.
zh: 秘书在记录老板口述的内容。

en: The secretary asked that I hold the line until Mr Williams was free to take my call.
zh: 秘书让我先别挂电话，等威廉姆斯先生有空了接听。

en: The secretary is within call all the time.
zh: 秘书一直随叫随到。

en: Has that secretarial position been filled?
zh: 那个秘书职位招到人了吗？

en: A secretarial post is open.
zh: 秘书职位有个空缺。

en: I had my secretary type the letter.
zh: 我让秘书把信打出来了。

en: My secretary is pushing for a promotion.
zh: 我的秘书正在争取升职。

en: I had my secretary run off ten copies.
zh: 我让秘书复印了十份。

en: He stared at me with a satirical smile.
zh: 他带着嘲讽的微笑盯着我。

en: Ironically it is war that has brought a great many useful inventions into being.
zh: 讽刺的是，正是战争催生了许多有用的发明。

en: It is fashionable to have leather chairs.
zh: 现在流行用皮椅子。

en: The skin tightened as it dried.
zh: 皮肤干了之后就变紧了。

en: I'm looking for a leather shoulder bag.
zh: 我正在找一款皮质单肩包。

en: What with fatigue and hunger, he was faint.
zh: 他又累又饿，快要晕过去了。

en: Mr. Sato collapsed from exhaustion.
zh: 佐藤先生由于过度劳累晕倒了。

en: When you feel tired, there is nothing like having a bath.
zh: 累了的时候，洗个澡最舒服了。

en: What with fatigue and hunger, he fell down as if he were dead.
zh: 他又累又饿，像死了一样倒在地上。

en: Are you tired?
zh: 你累了吗？

en: I am tired.
zh: 我累了。

en: My legs were leaden from fatigue.
zh: 我累得双腿像灌了铅一样沉。

en: As you are tired, you had better rest.
zh: 既然你累了，最好休息一下。

en: Since you're tired, you should rest.
zh: 既然你累了，就去休息吧。

en: Even though I was tired, I went to the party.
zh: 虽然我很累，但我还是去参加派对了。

en: Though he was tired, he kept on working.
zh: 虽然他很累，但他还是坚持工作。

en: He was tired, but he kept on working.
zh: 他很累，但他还在继续干。

en: Since you look tired, you had better go to bed early.
zh: 你看起来很累，最好早点睡。

en: There is no point in studying if you are feeling tired.
zh: 累了的话，学习也没什么意义。

en: As I was tired, I took a rest.
zh: 因为累了，我就休息了。

en: He must be tired.
zh: 他肯定累了。

en: It gone without saying, if you are tired, you should take a rest.
zh: 不用说，累了就应该休息。

en: You don't have to work so hard if you're tired.
zh: 如果你累了，就没必要这么拼命干活了。

en: I'm tired, but I'm going anyway.
zh: 我累了，但我还是要去。

en: He carried on working, regardless of whether he was tired or not.
zh: 不管累不累，他都一直在工作。

en: In spite of the fact that he was tired, he continued working.
zh: 尽管他很累，他还是继续工作。

en: Whether we were tired or not, we had to walk on.
zh: 不管累不累，我们都得继续往前走。

en: I was too tired to walk any farther.
zh: 我累得实在走不动了。

en: I'm too tired to walk any further.
zh: 我太累了，没法再走下去了。

en: I'm too tired to walk any more.
zh: 我累得走不动路了。

en: As I was tired, I went to bed.
zh: 因为我累了，所以去睡觉了。

en: I was tired so I went to bed.
zh: 我累了，所以去睡觉了。

en: Since I was tired, I went to bed.
zh: 因为累了，我就去睡觉了。

en: I was zoned out because I was tired.
zh: 因为太累了，我整个人都发懵了。

en: Being tired, he went to bed earlier than usual.
zh: 因为累了，他比平时睡得早。

en: Being tired, she went to bed early.
zh: 因为累了，她早早地就睡了。

en: Being tired, I felt like doing nothing.
zh: 累得我什么都不想做。

en: Since he was tired, he went to bed.
zh: 因为他累了，所以去睡觉了。

en: He was tired so he went to bed.
zh: 他累了，所以去睡了。

en: He went to bed because he was tired.
zh: 他去睡觉是因为他累了。

en: I was tired, so I went straight to bed.
zh: 我累了，就直接睡了。

en: John, being tired, went to bed early.
zh: 约翰累了，就早早睡了。

en: Though she was tired, she kept on working.
zh: 虽然她很累，但还在坚持干活。

en: Even though he was tired, he went on with his work.
zh: 哪怕他很累，也还是继续干活。

en: Although tired, she kept on working.
zh: 虽然累，但她还是在继续干。

en: She kept working even though she was tired.
zh: 她虽然累了，但还是在坚持工作。

en: She was tired, but she kept working.
zh: 她累了，但还是在继续工作。

en: You look tired. Shall I take the wheel?
zh: 你看着挺累的，要不我来开吧？

en: The tired boy is fast asleep.
zh: 那个累坏了的小男孩睡得正香呢。

en: I'm feeling tired.
zh: 我感觉挺累的。

en: He said he was tired, so he would go home early.
zh: 他说他累了，想早点回家。

en: I'm tired, so I think I'll turn in now.
zh: 我累了，想这就睡了。

en: I am exhausted.
zh: 我精疲力竭了。

en: I'm tired!
zh: 累死我了！

en: I'm pooped.
zh: 我累惨了。

en: I am tired!
zh: 我好累啊！

en: I'm exhausted!
zh: 我累透了！

en: When you feel tired, there is nothing like taking a bath.
zh: 累的时候，洗个热水澡最舒服了。

en: I'm tired. I just want to go on the teacup ride and take it easy.
zh: 我累了，只想去坐坐旋转咖啡杯，歇会儿。

en: He was so tired that he could hardly walk.
zh: 他累得都快走不动道了。

en: I was too exhausted to think, let alone study.
zh: 我累得脑子都转不动了，更别提学习了。

en: I was too tired to care for anything but bed.
zh: 我累得只想睡觉，别的什么都不想管。

en: Fatigue showed on her face.
zh: 她脸上露出了疲倦的神色。

en: As long as a bear is relatively inactive, and is not exposed to wind, it does not burn excessive energy in cold weather.
zh: 只要熊不怎么活动且没吹到风，天冷的时候就不会消耗太多体力。

en: Comparative studies are now making rapid progress.
zh: 比较研究现在进展挺快的。

en: Critics may argue that all the foregoing characterizations are very abstract.
zh: 评论家可能会说，刚才那些描述都太抽象了。

en: Critics thought little of the play.
zh: 评论家们觉得这出戏不怎么样。

en: Don't be so sensitive to criticism.
zh: 别对批评太敏感了。

en: Don't be too sensitive to criticism.
zh: 别太在意别人的批评。

en: There is eloquence in screaming.
zh: 尖叫也是一种表达。

en: A scream broke the silence.
zh: 一声尖叫打破了宁静。

en: Didn't you hear a scream?
zh: 你没听见有人尖叫吗？

en: Didn't you hear the scream?
zh: 你没听见那声尖叫吗？

en: Hearing the sad news, she collapsed in tears.
zh: 听到那个坏消息，她一下子就哭瘫了。

en: She all but wept when she heard the bad news.
zh: 听到那个坏消息，她差点没哭出来。

en: The tragedy happened suddenly.
zh: 悲剧发生得太突然了。

en: The heart of the tragedy, as of a short story, is a conflict.
zh: 悲剧的核心，跟短篇小说一样，就是冲突。

en: Tragedy fell over the town.
zh: 悲剧降临到了这个小镇。

en: Now that pessimism prevails, the executive will abandon the project.
zh: 既然现在大家都很悲观，主管估计要放弃这个项目了。

en: Let go of your negative outlook on life.
zh: 别对生活这么消极。

en: Pessimism believes in no improvement.
zh: 悲观的人总觉得情况好不起来。

en: Do not obtrude upon her sorrow.
zh: 别在这个时候去烦她。

en: Don't intrude on her sorrow.
zh: 别去惊扰她的悲伤。

en: Why should you be sad?
zh: 你有什么好难过的？

en: Forget your sorrows.
zh: 把那些不开心的事都忘了吧。

en: Pools of sorrow, wave of joy.
zh: 悲喜交加。

en: Grief drove her mad.
zh: 极度的悲伤让她疯了。

en: Grief has silvered her hair.
zh: 悲伤让她愁白了头。

en: She was beside herself with grief.
zh: 她伤心得不能自已。

en: The grieving woman was consoled by her friends.
zh: 那个悲痛的女人在朋友们的安慰下好受了些。

en: I am filled with sorrow.
zh: 我心里充满了悲伤。

en: Sorrow filled his breast.
zh: 他内心充满了悲哀。

en: His heart was pierced with grief.
zh: 他心如刀割。

en: Don't be sad.
zh: 别难过。

en: I wear a sad look.
zh: 我一脸愁容。

en: Smiling sadly, she began to talk.
zh: 她苦笑着开始说话了。

en: In her grief, she burst into tears.
zh: 她在悲恸中失声痛哭。

en: Sad as she was, she said good-bye to him with a smile.
zh: 尽管很伤心，她还是微笑着跟他告别。

en: I was moved to tears by the tragic story.
zh: 那个悲惨的故事让我掉眼泪了。

en: You will have heard the sad news.
zh: 你估计已经听说那个坏消息了。

en: The sad story moved us to tears.
zh: 那个悲伤的故事把我们都说哭了。

en: The sad news took away his appetite.
zh: 那个坏消息让他难过得吃不下饭。

en: Forget the sad affair.
zh: 忘掉那些不开心的事吧。

en: When I'm sad, my friends encourage me.
zh: 我难过的时候，朋友们都会鼓励我。

en: Sad memories always haunt the child.
zh: 那些悲伤的回忆总是缠绕着那个孩子。

en: Don't feel sad or ill at ease.
zh: 别难过，也别觉得不自在。

en: I'm sad.
zh: 我很难过。

en: I forget sad things when I fall asleep.
zh: 我一睡着就会忘掉那些烦心事。

en: Sadly, his dream didn't come true.
zh: 遗憾的是，他的梦想没能实现。

en: Sadly, my cat has gone away somewhere.
zh: 真难受，我的猫走丢了。

en: To my sorrow, my father cannot attend the meeting.
zh: 让我遗憾的是，我父亲没法参加这个会。

en: Sad to say, her son died young.
zh: 遗憾的是，她儿子年纪轻轻就走了。

en: To her sorrow, she had no one to rely on.
zh: 让她难过的是，她没个人能依靠。

en: To her sorrow, her only son left her alone.
zh: 让她伤心的是，她唯一的儿子丢下她一个人不管。

en: To everyone's sorrow, the poet died young.
zh: 让大家都很悲伤的是，这位诗人英年早逝。

en: He gave me a good piece of advice.
zh: 他给我提了个很好的建议。

en: He has been intent on learning French.
zh: 他一直在一心一意地学法语。

en: I can't conceive of living without him.
zh: 我没法想象没有他的日子怎么过。

en: I really like him, but not his circle of friends.
zh: 我挺喜欢他的，但不太喜欢他的朋友圈子。

en: You look sick.
zh: 你看起来气色不太好。

en: He came in person.
zh: 他亲自过来了。

en: You should put your ideas in writing.
zh: 你应该把你的想法写下来。

en: He felt uneasy in his father's presence.
zh: 他在他父亲面前觉得很不自在。

en: His own way of doing things is not popular with us.
zh: 他的那套做事方式在我们这儿不受欢迎。

en: Both of them are very brilliant.
zh: 他们俩都非常聪明。

en: They determined the date for the trip.
zh: 他们定好了旅行的日期。

en: You ought not to make fun of them.
zh: 你不该拿他们开涮。

en: They fell in love the moment their eyes met.
zh: 他们对视的那一刻就一见钟情了。

en: They held a special session on trade problems.
zh: 他们针对贸易问题专门开了个会。

en: They supplied the soldiers with enough food and water.
zh: 他们给士兵们提供了充足的食物和水。

en: They usually shear sheep in spring.
zh: 他们通常在春天剪羊毛。

en: They gave him a chance to escape.
zh: 他们给了他一个逃跑的机会。

en: They were listening to him, not understanding what he really meant.
zh: 他们听着他说话，但并没听懂他到底想表达什么。

en: They eagerly supported his new policy.
zh: 他们非常支持他的新政策。

en: They were separated into two groups.
zh: 他们被分成了两组。

en: They shed their blood for their independence.
zh: 他们为独立洒下了鲜血。

en: They went down to the country.
zh: 他们下乡去了。

en: They endured many difficulties.
zh: 他们吃了不少苦。

en: They moved to a new house.
zh: 他们搬新家了。

en: They are in class.
zh: 他们正在上课呢。

en: They shot the film in an actual desert.
zh: 他们是在真正的沙漠里拍的那部电影。

en: They fought for freedom.
zh: 他们为了自由而战。

en: They painted their house bright yellow.
zh: 他们把房子漆成了亮黄色。

en: Do you think they will invite us to the film showing?
zh: 你觉得他们会请咱们去看电影放映吗？

en: They invited me to dinner.
zh: 他们请我吃晚饭。

en: They are pleased with your work.
zh: 他们对你的工作挺满意的。

en: They showed me a lot of beautiful photos.
zh: 他们给我看了很多漂亮的照片。

en: They have finished their work.
zh: 他们把活儿干完了。

en: They left at 5 o'clock, so they ought to be home by 6.
zh: 他们5点走的，6点前应该到家了。

en: They did not notice minute differences.
zh: 他们没察觉到那些细微的差别。

en: They looked satisfied with the result.
zh: 他们看起来对结果挺满意的。

en: They accomplished their task without any difficulty.
zh: 他们没费什么劲就完成了任务。

en: They never meet without quarreling.
zh: 他们一见面就吵架。

en: While they don't agree, they continue to be friends.
zh: 虽然他们意见不合，但还是好朋友。

en: They added a woman to the committee.
zh: 他们在委员会里加了一个女的。

en: They hid themselves in the shadows.
zh: 他们躲在阴影里。

en: They looked down on him.
zh: 他们瞧不起他。

en: They did win.
zh: 他们确实赢了。

en: They really did win.
zh: 他们是真的赢了。

en: They will have arrived at Morioka by noon.
zh: 中午前他们应该已经到盛冈了。

en: They invited me to play cards.
zh: 他们找我一起打牌。

en: They were watching television.
zh: 他们在看电视。

en: They keep numbers of sheep.
zh: 他们养了好多羊。

en: They climbed down the tree.
zh: 他们从树上爬了下来。

en: They live from hand to mouth.
zh: 他们过着勉强糊口的生活。

en: They have cherished the child as their own.
zh: 他们把这孩子当成亲生的来疼。

en: They are at war with the country.
zh: 他们正在和那个国家交战。

en: They remained good friends.
zh: 他们一直是好朋友。

en: They were shoveling the snow away.
zh: 他们当时在铲雪。

en: They labored day after day.
zh: 他们日复一日地劳作。

en: They all agreed to a man that this statement was true.
zh: 他们一致认为这话是真的。

en: They are disappointed with each other.
zh: 他们对彼此都很失望。

en: They are victims of the so-called war.
zh: 他们是所谓战争的受害者。

en: They are what we call hot rodders.
zh: 他们就是我们常说的飙车党。

en: They talked about various subjects.
zh: 他们聊了各种各样的话题。

en: They are always hard up for food.
zh: 他们总是缺吃的。

en: They supplied the war victims with food.
zh: 他们给战争难民提供了食物。

en: They continued eating as if nothing had happened.
zh: 他们像没事人一样继续吃。

en: Their friendship moved us deeply.
zh: 他们的友谊深深打动了我们。

en: Their number is great.
zh: 他们的人数很多。

en: Their job is to read the news clearly and carefully.
zh: 他们的工作就是口齿清晰、认真地播报新闻。

en: Their house is just opposite the bus stop.
zh: 他们家就在公交车站对面。

en: They led me to believe that there was no danger.
zh: 他们让我误以为没危险。

en: They have no house to live in.
zh: 他们没房子住。

en: They don't have an ear for music.
zh: 他们没什么音乐细胞。

en: They don't have anything in common at all.
zh: 他们完全没有共同点。

en: I felt very sorry that I had put them to so much trouble.
zh: 给他们添了这么多麻烦，我感到挺过意不去的。

en: You must not go there with them.
zh: 你千万别跟他们一起去那儿。

en: I should never have thought they would take such a fancy to their teacher.
zh: 我压根儿没想到他们会那么迷恋老师。

en: I never thought that they would like their teacher so much.
zh: 我压根儿没想到他们会这么喜欢他们的老师。

en: It was heroic of them to oppose the enemy.
zh: 他们英勇反抗敌人的行为真够英雄的。

en: The woman whom they interviewed yesterday has been given the job.
zh: 昨天面试的那个女的已经拿到这份工作了。

en: What they told you is not true.
zh: 他们跟你说的不是真的。

en: What they told you isn't true.
zh: 他们跟你说的那些话不是真话。

en: Do you know when they will be back?
zh: 你知道他们什么时候回来吗？

en: He stressed the convenient aspects of city life.
zh: 他强调了城市生活方便的地方。

en: She thanked me for the present.
zh: 她因为那份礼物谢了我。

en: She's on the rolls.
zh: 她的名字在名册上。

en: He gave himself up to her allure.
zh: 他完全被她的魅力迷住了。

en: She's off with the flu.
zh: 她得了流感，没来。

en: She stands out from the rest.
zh: 她在人群中很出众。

en: She is not smart, but she is built.
zh: 她不怎么聪明，但身材很有料。

en: She's a lady of iron will.
zh: 她是个意志坚强的女人。

en: It took her a long time to choose a hat.
zh: 她挑帽子挑了老半天。

en: They asked after my father.
zh: 他们打听了我父亲的近况。

en: The women longed to climb up the social ladder.
zh: 那些女的一心想挤进上流社会。

en: She's new fish in the pond.
zh: 她是刚来的新人。

en: I'm afraid all my efforts to help her will be to no purpose.
zh: 我怕我为了帮她做的努力都白费了。

en: She has a nice line in self-deprecation.
zh: 她挺擅长自黑的。

en: She is not bad in herself.
zh: 她这人本性其实不坏。

en: She was at a loss what to do next.
zh: 她当时不知道接下来该怎么办。

en: She's on a roll.
zh: 她最近势头正劲。

en: Her harsh manner of speaking doesn't suit her pretty face.
zh: 她说话那么刻薄，跟她那张漂亮的脸蛋真不搭。

en: No one was absent except her.
zh: 除了她，大家都到了。

en: He loves no one but her.
zh: 他只爱她一个人。

en: His vain efforts to seduce her showed he was barking up the wrong tree; she was a mother of two tots.
zh: 他白费劲想勾引她，真是找错人了，人家可是两个孩子的妈。

en: Trying to tempt her, I gazed into her face.
zh: 为了诱惑她，我注视着她的脸。

en: I tried in vain to seduce her.
zh: 我想勾引她，但没成功。

en: I hugged her.
zh: 我抱了抱她。

en: I am responsible for her protection.
zh: 我负责保护她。

en: I'm responsible for protecting her.
zh: 保护她是我的责任。

en: He lured her away from her husband.
zh: 他把她从她老公身边勾走了。

en: It was no use trying to take her to the hospital.
zh: 试着带她去医院也没用了。

en: I must make sure of the fact before I blame her.
zh: 在责怪她之前，我得先弄清事实。

en: I'll try her out as a secretary.
zh: 我会让她试着当个秘书。

en: They made her marry him.
zh: 他们逼她嫁给了他。

en: It was his silence which made her angry.
zh: 正是他的沉默让她生气的。

en: It was his silence that made her angry.
zh: 让她生气的就是他的沉默。

en: Would you mind putting her on the phone?
zh: 能请她接个电话吗？

en: Send her in, and I will see her now.
zh: 让她进来，我现在就见她。

en: I gave her a lift to town.
zh: 我顺路捎她去了城里。

en: The better you get to know her, the more you'll like her.
zh: 你越了解她，就越会喜欢她。

en: The more you get to know her, the more you'll like her.
zh: 你对她了解得越多，就越喜欢她。

en: Who that knows her doesn't love her?
zh: 认识她的人哪有不喜欢她的？

en: Do you know her?
zh: 你认识她吗？

en: Does she know?
zh: 她知道吗？

en: Need we wait for her?
zh: 我们需要等她吗？

en: Do we need to wait for her?
zh: 我们得等她吗？

en: There was nothing for it but to wait for her.
zh: 没办法，只能等她了。

en: I found it difficult to convince her.
zh: 我觉得很难说服她。

en: It is a labor to persuade her.
zh: 说服她挺费劲的。

en: It's no use trying to persuade her.
zh: 劝她也没用。

en: It's no good trying to persuade her.
zh: 怎么劝她都没用。

en: We must talk her out of this foolish plan.
zh: 我们必须劝她打消这个愚蠢的念头。

en: I can't help laughing at her.
zh: 我忍不住想笑她。

en: I ran the risk of losing my job to help her.
zh: 我冒着丢工作的风险去帮她。

en: I think all my efforts to help her will just be a waste of my time.
zh: 我觉得我帮她全是白费工夫。

en: Take her to surgery.
zh: 送她去手术室。

en: Carry her to the operating room.
zh: 把她抬进手术室。

en: Take her to the OR.
zh: 带她去手术室。

en: It's pride that drives her.
zh: 她是靠着自尊心在那儿撑着。

en: I was filled with frightful sorrow for her.
zh: 我为她感到特别难过。

en: I have known her since she was a little girl.
zh: 她从小我就认识她了。

en: When did you see her last?
zh: 你上次见她是什么时候？

en: To do her justice, she is not plain.
zh: 说句公道话，她长得不难看。

en: We sent some flowers to the hospital to cheer her up.
zh: 我们送了些花到医院，想让她开心点。

en: We have been to see her off.
zh: 我们去给她送行了。

en: I've just been to the airport to see her off.
zh: 我刚去机场送完她。

en: I have been to the station to see her off.
zh: 我刚去车站送她了。

en: To see her is to love her.
zh: 谁见了她都会爱上她的。

en: I couldn't bear to look at her.
zh: 我不忍心看她。

en: He saw her and blushed.
zh: 他一见到她就脸红了。

en: He turned pale the instant he saw her.
zh: 他一见到她，脸色唰地一下就白了。

en: The idea of surprising her suddenly crossed my mind.
zh: 我脑子里突然冒出个念头，想给她个惊喜。

en: Go and wake her up.
zh: 去把她叫醒。

en: I cannot but feel sorry for him.
zh: 我忍不住同情他。

en: I found it difficult to please her.
zh: 我觉得很难讨好她。

en: Being anxious to please her, I bought her a nice present.
zh: 为了讨好她，我特意给她买了个漂亮的礼物。

en: I will do anything to please her.
zh: 只要能让她开心，我什么都愿意做。

en: Defend her from danger.
zh: 保护她免受伤害。

en: Protect her from danger.
zh: 保护她，别让她遇到危险。

en: If you hurt her, I'll kill you.
zh: 你要是敢伤害她，我就杀了你。

en: She wants to move out and find a place of her own.
zh: 她想搬出去自己住。

en: You've got to see her home.
zh: 你得送她回家。

en: I invited her to go to the movies.
zh: 我请她去看电影了。

en: I invited her to a movie.
zh: 我约了她看电影。

en: As soon as he took a look at her, he fell in love.
zh: 他一看到她就沦陷了。

en: Don't try to keep her to yourself.
zh: 别总想着独占她。

en: We thought it wrong to leave her alone.
zh: 我们觉得把她一个人丢在那儿不太好。

en: We'd better leave her alone.
zh: 我们最好别去打扰她。

en: I'd take anybody apart who dared to say a word against her.
zh: 谁要是敢说她一句坏话，我非跟他拼命不可。

en: Who doesn't love her?
zh: 谁会不爱她呢？

en: I cannot help falling in love with her.
zh: 我忍不住爱上了她。

en: There is no man but admires her.
zh: 没有哪个男人不仰慕她。

en: I want to ask her out, but I don't have the courage.
zh: 我想约她出来，但没那个胆量。

en: We didn't take her on as a typist.
zh: 我们没录用她当打字员。

en: Let's put her in charge of that.
zh: 那件事就交给她负责吧。

en: Let's leave her alone.
zh: 别去理她了。

en: I'm going to keep my distance from her for a while.
zh: 我打算先跟她保持点距离。

en: Don't scold her; she's too young to understand.
zh: 别骂她了，她还太小，不懂事。

en: Don't scold her. She's too young to understand.
zh: 别骂她，她还太小，不懂事。

en: She shall come here.
zh: 她得来这儿。

en: I'll have her come here.
zh: 我让她过来。

en: I'll get her to come here.
zh: 我叫她过来。

en: He gave her a drug to make her relax.
zh: 他给她吃了点药让她放松一下。

en: I called her by the name of Cathy.
zh: 我叫她 Cathy。

en: Don't make fun of her. She just chugged three bottles of beer.
zh: 别取笑她，她刚一口气灌了三瓶啤酒。

en: Don't make sport of her.
zh: 别拿她开涮。

en: I did not mean to disappoint her.
zh: 我不是故意要让她失望的。

en: They couldn't communicate their ideas to men.
zh: 她们没法跟男人交流想法。

en: They bubbled over with joy.
zh: 她们乐坏了。

en: They wore identical dresses.
zh: 她们穿着一模一样的裙子。

en: They couldn't help being surprised at the news.
zh: 听到这个消息，她们忍不住大吃一惊。

en: They dreamed they'd gain the right to vote someday.
zh: 她们梦想着有一天能获得投票权。

en: They are both good students.
zh: 她们两个都是好学生。

en: They are pretty.
zh: 她们挺漂亮的。

en: Their envy was directed toward her beauty.
zh: 她们很嫉妒她的美貌。

en: "Is she coming, too?" "I hope so."
zh: “她也来吗？”“希望如此。”

en: Is she coming, too?
zh: 她也来吗？

en: She and hers are all very well.
zh: 她和她家里人都挺好的。

en: She doesn't understand me, either.
zh: 她也不懂我。

en: She is no less beautiful than her sister.
zh: 她跟她姐姐一样漂亮。

en: She has grown up to be a woman.
zh: 她已经长成大姑娘了。

en: She bought the dictionary, too.
zh: 她也买了那本词典。

en: She broke the cup, too.
zh: 她也把杯子打碎了。

en: She's off and running.
zh: 她已经风风火火地开始了。

en: She was about to start.
zh: 她正准备开始。

en: No woman is as arrogant as she is.
zh: 没有哪个女人像她这么傲慢。

en: I had left a present for her at my house.
zh: 我把给她的礼物落在我家里了。

en: All my advice was lost on her.
zh: 我的建议她一个字也没听进去。

en: What is the Christmas gift we are giving to her?
zh: 咱们送她什么圣诞礼物好呢？

en: What souvenir do you think she would like most?
zh: 你觉得她最喜欢什么样的纪念品？

en: She bore her misfortunes with a brave spirit.
zh: 她勇敢地面对了自己的不幸。

en: She was brought up in the lap of luxury.
zh: 她是娇生惯养长大的。

en: She has a rose in her hand.
zh: 她手里拿着一朵玫瑰。

en: She grew roses.
zh: 她种了些玫瑰。

en: She got angry with the naughty boy.
zh: 她跟那个调皮的小男孩生气了。

en: She has her arm in a cast.
zh: 她的胳膊打着石膏。

en: Her arms were wrapped around her knees, her chin rested on her locked hands.
zh: 她双手抱膝，下巴托在交叠的手背上。

en: She had her purse snatched from her arm.
zh: 她的皮包被人从胳膊上抢走了。

en: She has a bag under her arm.
zh: 她腋下夹着个包。

en: She is very good at changing the subject.
zh: 她特别擅长转移话题。

en: She changed the subject.
zh: 她转移了话题。

en: She stopped talking.
zh: 她不说话了。

en: She was afraid to make a speech.
zh: 她不敢当众发言。

en: She composed herself before speaking.
zh: 她在开口说话前先平复了一下情绪。

en: She has a habit of coughing before she speaks.
zh: 她习惯在说话前先咳嗽一下。

en: She continued her talk.
zh: 她继续往下说。

en: She is extremely vulgar in her speech.
zh: 她说话粗俗得很。

en: Her voice began to rise as she spoke.
zh: 她说着说着，嗓门就大了起来。

en: She went on speaking.
zh: 她继续说了下去。

en: She is a bad speaker.
zh: 她不太会说话。

en: She looks better in Japanese clothes.
zh: 她穿和服更好看。

en: She pretended to be asleep during the debate.
zh: 辩论的时候她假装睡着了。

en: She began lessons in piano at age 6.
zh: 她6岁开始学钢琴。

en: She began piano lessons when she was six years old.
zh: 她6岁的时候开始上钢琴课。

en: She shot a warm smile at the old lady.
zh: 她对那位老太太温柔地笑了笑。

en: She walked with her head down like an old woman.
zh: 她低着头走路，像个老太太。

en: She led the old man into the room.
zh: 她领着那个老人进了房间。

en: She helped an old man cross the road.
zh: 她扶一位老人过马路。

en: She helped the old man across the street.
zh: 她扶着那个老人过马路。

en: She helped the old man cross the road.
zh: 她帮那个老人过马路。

en: She gave her seat to a senior citizen.
zh: 她给老人让了座。

en: She gave up her seat for the old person.
zh: 她把座位让给了那个老人。

en: She is kind to old people.
zh: 她对老人很友善。

en: She helped the old man across.
zh: 她扶那个老人过了马路。

en: She provided for her old age.
zh: 她为自己的晚年做了打算。

en: She looked after her old mother.
zh: 她照顾年迈的母亲。

en: She took the trouble to meet her friend at the airport.
zh: 她特意去机场接了她的朋友。

en: She made a series of medical discoveries.
zh: 她在医学上有一系列发现。

en: She searched for her granddaughter who had been taken away.
zh: 她在寻找被带走的孙女。

en: Has she ever fallen in love?
zh: 她谈过恋爱吗？

en: She gave herself to flames of love.
zh: 她陷入了热恋。

en: She was disappointed in love.
zh: 她失恋了。

en: She's giving herself up to love.
zh: 她正全身心地投入到恋爱中。

en: She elbowed her way onto the train.
zh: 她硬挤上了火车。

en: She couldn't stand the heat in the train.
zh: 她受不了火车里的闷热。

en: She had to stand in the train.
zh: 她在火车上只能站着。

en: She hurried to the station so as not to miss the train.
zh: 她匆忙赶往车站，以免误了火车。

en: She was anxious lest she might miss the train.
zh: 她很担心会赶不上火车。

en: She was worried that she might miss the train.
zh: 她怕自己错过火车。

en: She was worried that she might be late for the train.
zh: 她担心赶不上火车。

en: She may have missed the train.
zh: 她可能没赶上火车。

en: She went to the back of the line.
zh: 她排到了队伍最后面。

en: She majored in history.
zh: 她大学学的是历史。

en: She has fine manners.
zh: 她很有礼貌。

en: She didn't utter a single word of encouragement.
zh: 她一句鼓励的话都没说。

en: She continued to talk coolly.
zh: 她继续冷静地讲着。

en: She gave me the fish eye.
zh: 她冷冰冰地瞟了我一眼。

en: She is more shy than cold.
zh: 她与其说是冷淡，不如说是害羞。

en: She heated up the cold soup for supper.
zh: 她把冷汤热了热当晚饭。

en: She was taken in by that fake gold certificate scandal and lost most of her money.
zh: 她被那个假黄金券骗局给坑了，亏了大部分钱。

en: She answered with tears.
zh: 她哭着回答。

en: She answered in tears.
zh: 她流着泪回答。

en: She was crying as she answered.
zh: 她回答的时候一直在哭。

en: She sang the song with tears running down her cheeks.
zh: 她满脸泪水地唱了那首歌。

en: She shed tears.
zh: 她流泪了。

en: She tried not to shed tears.
zh: 她努力不让自己流下眼泪。

en: It appeared that she was trying to keep back tears.
zh: 她看起来在强忍泪水。

en: She implored mercy with tears running down her cheeks.
zh: 她泪流满面地乞求原谅。

en: She wiped away her tears.
zh: 她抹了抹眼泪。

en: She restrained tears with difficulty.
zh: 她好不容易才忍住眼泪。

en: She could not refrain from tears.
zh: 她忍不住流下了眼泪。

en: She couldn't keep from crying.
zh: 她忍不住哭了出来。

en: She couldn't help but cry.
zh: 她忍不住哭了。

en: She couldn't stop the tears.
zh: 她止不住眼泪。

en: She is easily moved to tears.
zh: 她动不动就掉眼泪。

en: She controlled her tears.
zh: 她克制住了眼泪。

en: She told her story in tears.
zh: 她哭着诉说着自己的故事。

en: She bore her grief with dry eyes.
zh: 她强忍悲痛，没掉一滴泪。

en: She parted from her friend in tears.
zh: 她流着泪和朋友告别。

en: Her tears burst forth.
zh: 她的眼泪夺眶而出。

en: She is always finding fault with her neighbors.
zh: 她总是挑邻居的毛病。

en: She was jealous of her neighbor's good fortune.
zh: 她眼红邻居过得好。

en: She is in a green dress.
zh: 她穿着一件绿裙子。

en: She had a clear conscience.
zh: 她问心无愧。

en: She looked like a daughter of a good family.
zh: 她看起来像个大家闺秀。

en: She behaves as if she had been brought up in a good family.
zh: 她的一举一动都显得很有教养。

en: She thought of the fine autumn day when she had rushed home from school with the good news; she was chosen to be on the relay team.
zh: 她想起了那个秋高气爽的日子，那天她带着被选入接力队的好消息，从学校飞奔回家。

en: In addition to being a good teacher, she was a great scholar.
zh: 她不仅是个好老师，还是个博学的大学者。

en: She'll make a good wife.
zh: 她会是个好妻子的。

en: She can't tell right from wrong.
zh: 她是非不分。

en: She's thinking of taking a couple of courses at a cooking school.
zh: 她在考虑去烹饪学校上几门课。

en: She is used to cooking.
zh: 她习惯做饭。

en: She has a strong liking for cooking.
zh: 她非常喜欢做饭。

en: She got a slight burn on her hand while cooking.
zh: 她做饭的时候手被轻微烫伤了。

en: She prides herself on her skill in cooking.
zh: 她对自己的厨艺很自豪。

en: She is quite ignorant of cooking.
zh: 她对做饭一窍不通。

en: She has an encyclopedic knowledge of cooking.
zh: 她对烹饪知识了如指掌。

en: She knows everything about cooking.
zh: 她对做饭的事儿门儿清。

en: She made much use of milk in her cooking.

zh: 她不得不舍弃她的首饰盒。

en: She will write a letter after school.
zh: 她放学后会写封信。

en: She plans to write a letter after school.
zh: 她打算放学后写封信。

en: She proudly displayed her jewels.
zh: 她得意地展示着她的珠宝。

en: She was captured trying to steal jewelry.
zh: 她偷珠宝的时候被抓住了。

en: She adorned herself with jewels.
zh: 她佩戴着各种珠宝首饰。

en: She was tricked up in jewels.
zh: 她穿戴得珠光宝气的。

en: She won ten million yen in the lottery.
zh: 她彩票中了一千万日元。

en: She is busy typing the reports.
zh: 她正忙着打报告呢。

en: She cut up the cloth to make bandages.
zh: 她把布剪开做成绷带。

en: She handed the parcel to the customer.
zh: 她把包裹递给了顾客。

en: She is no more careful than her mother is.
zh: 她跟她妈一样，都不怎么细心。

en: She was accompanied by her mother.
zh: 她是由她妈妈陪着的。

en: She takes after her mother.
zh: 她长得挺像她妈的。

en: She loved her mother dearly.
zh: 她非常爱她的母亲。

en: She cried out the moment she saw her mother.
zh: 她一见到她妈就叫了出来。

en: She smiled at the sight of her mother.
zh: 她一看到她妈就笑了。

en: She was anxious to please her mother.
zh: 她急着想讨她妈欢心。

en: She shot a glance at her mother.
zh: 她瞥了她妈一眼。

en: She made little of her mother's advice and went out alone.
zh: 她没把她妈的建议当回事，自己一个人出去了。

en: She was fond of going to parties, as was her mother when she was young.
zh: 她跟她妈年轻时一样，很喜欢参加派对。

en: She can't talk about her mother without choking up.
zh: 她一提起她母亲就忍不住哽咽。

en: She is always running after her mother.
zh: 她总是粘着她妈妈。

en: She doesn't take after her mother at all.
zh: 她一点儿也不像她妈。

en: She is no less beautiful than her mother.
zh: 她跟她妈一样漂亮。

en: She really takes after her mother.
zh: 她真的很像她妈。

en: I don't think she takes after her mother.
zh: 我不觉得她长得像她妈。

en: She looks like her mother.
zh: 她长得像她妈妈。

en: She is in a hurry to see her mother.
zh: 她急着去见她妈。

en: She closely resembles her mother.
zh: 她长得跟她妈一模一样。
